intro: Laplacea tomentosa var. typica, commonly known as the woolly laplacea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, grayish-green leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its foliage is covered in fine, soft hairs, which give it a distinctive, fluffy appearance. The flowers are clustered in terminal inflorescences and bloom during the warmer months of the year.
